Heyo, after running our path planner auto, our field oriented is backwards. Idk whats up. We’re gonna try to debug it tommorow, but I want something to go off of or for someone to just call us out. GitHub - NoahLacks/FRC-2648-2025

For both red and blue alliance? I’d guess that you need a little code that inverts your joysticks if you are the red alliance. (Multiply by -1)

I would start by comparing what glass or advantage scope says is happening v. What is happening in the real world. If your robot is going the correct way on the field widget then you probably have a control issue.

Is it confusing because Pathplanner, etc are field oriented…. But in teleop you really want your controls to be operator relative.

Apologies, didn’t mean to make it sound like I thought you were doubting me. I’m bouncing between a few conversations so my wires are a bit crossed.

And what do you mean by simulation? I’m a rookie programmer, and we generally dont do simulations as far as i’m aware

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-03-04T03:56:54.165Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":79,"readers_count":78,"score":20.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":494144,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-field-oriented-issues","display_username":"Noah LazerBeams","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":36169,"username":"Hollisms","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hollisms/{size}/110925_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52301,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming, Driving, Singing"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-field-oriented-issues/494144/8","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3546952,"name":"","username":"Hollisms","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hollisms/{size}/110925_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-04T04:04:42.706Z","cooked":"

. No worries.

I’m guessing that when you zero your gyro you rotate the robot hit the zero button and it drives correctly.

I’m also guessing that when you line up your robot on the field you have it rotated 180 from the orientation you use to zero it manually.

Correct?

all that is correct, yes

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-03-04T04:05:18.643Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":70,"readers_count":69,"score":19.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":494144,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-field-oriented-issues","display_username":"Noah LazerBeams","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":36169,"username":"Hollisms","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hollisms/{size}/110925_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52301,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming, Driving, Singing"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-field-oriented-issues/494144/10","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3546955,"name":"","username":"Hollisms","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hollisms/{size}/110925_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-04T04:09:54.896Z","cooked":"

So yeah you have the front and back of your robot reversed. What you think is the front is actually the back.

You need to invert your joystick input by putting a minus sign in front of the joystick inputs. And then zero it 180 degrees from what you have been doing.

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2025-03-04T04:12:07.109Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":81,"readers_count":80,"score":16.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":494144,"topic_slug":"swerve-drive-field-oriented-issues","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":52301,"username":"NoahLacks","name":"Noah LazerBeams","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/noahlacks/{size}/250843_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":36169,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Software Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-drive-field-oriented-issues/494144/13","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3547070,"name":"Andy Nguyen","username":"ShinyShips","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/shinyships/{size}/7535_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-04T11:56:11.841Z","cooked":"

Are you getting your alliance during disabled? We ran into a similar issue at Southern Maine this weekend because there is a bug with FMS that sends the wrong alliance information first and then corrects it once the match starts.

This led us to have to drive with our controls flipped/our autos going the wrong way all competition until we saw the alliance get set wrong from FMS on our dashboard in Elims and the FTA confirmed the bug. We had asked a CSA about if we were possibly getting the wrong alliance information from FMS Saturday evening but the CSA was not aware of the bug. Unfortunately they didn’t let us fix the issue by hard coding, and were told to look at it after the match. This led to our auto going backwards, us losing the match, and being eliminated from the tournament

This information is good to know.

We created a command DriveFieldOrientedRED and DriveFiledOrientedBLUE.

Would adding code to check alliance and set to proper Drive command in TeleOpInit overcome that bug?

I am not our software Mentor nor did I write the code that handles any of this, but I was the software lead for 3314 in 2015-2016. Software has changed a lot since then but this is the jist I got.

What I believe we were doing was getting the alliance information during disabled so that we could do all our calculations before Autonomous.

This thread discusses a similar or the same bug two years ago. Their recommendation is to get the information in autonomous init. We are probably going to put a physical switch on the robot to tell the robot what alliance it is on

I am no software person, but our team experienced the same issues and it was painful on practice day whenever we tried to play on the red side.
The CSA at our event helped us put in a while loop to keep asking FMS which side we are on, and then make it red.
We only had a single hard line code that said we are on red.
Thus it’s a race issue between FMS and our code, where FMS doesnt pick up which side we are on and defaults to blue. Once the changes were made, we were good, but it was 3 hours of frustration to say the least.

I agree it can be tricky. The attribute is an optional, so you need to handle the case where the DriverStation doesn’t know yet. Checking for it repeatedly while disabled is a good practice. I wasn’t aware that the FMS bug. If somebody has a link to a bug report, I would appreciate it being shared!
